intro: Sieglingia filiformis, commonly known as the slender sieglingia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Sieglingia filiformis is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
